metadata.title: CVE-2019-13309 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
ImageMagick 7.0.8-50 Q16 has memory leaks at AcquireMagickMemory because ofmishandling the NoSuchImage error in CLIListOperatorImages inMagickWand/operation.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-13309` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.15
imagemagick-6.q16 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.15
imagemagick-common - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.15
libimage-magick-perl - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.15
libimage-magick-q16-perl - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.15
libmagick++-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.15
libmagick++-6.q16-5v5 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.15
libmagickcore-6-arch-config - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.15
libmagickcore-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.15
libmagickcore-6.q16-2 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.15
libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.15
libmagickwand-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.15
libmagickwand-6.q16-2 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.15
perlmagick - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.15
No subscription required

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.15').
